dialogues.text: She likes you. John looks up from the baby to see... Gwen. She is the epitome of the girl you never quite get over. John stands. He doesn’t know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hi. Gwen is nervous and self conscious.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I look... different.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You look beautiful. Gwen tears up. She and John are both very emotional. John walks over to Gwen to kiss her hello. Gwen full on kisses John on the lips. He pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your husband’s in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: It’s not working out.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: He’s going to be back any minute.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I missed you.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I missed you, too. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gwen slaps John.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: You should have called me.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I know. Jason walks in from the kitchen holding two Budweisers in his hands. When he enters the living room he finds Gwen and John studying their bookshelf. Gwen pulls a graphic novel called, “Blankets”. On the cover are two young adults holding each other in a snowy forest.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Have you ever read this? John looks up at her knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: It’s the best book ever made.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I thought you’d like it. Jason walks over. He hands John a beer.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I think it’s depressing.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: You think everything’s depressing. Awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: So... He looks at the baby.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How'd you get Quinn to stop crying?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. John did it.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What are you? Like a baby whisperer or something? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Jason can never get her to stop crying.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: You hungry?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah, starving.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Let’s eat. Gwen and John leave the living room. Jason bends down to talk to his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Hey, sweetheart. You ready to eat? The baby starts crying again. Jason frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner is over. The baby is asleep finally. There are dirty plates all around. Empty beer bottles litter the table.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: So, why didn’t your girlfriend come back with you? Gwen reacts.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: You have a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I didn't tell you?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: No. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Yeah. They’re going to have a kid. Gwen is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Oh.... Oh. Wow. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: When is she due?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Soon.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: They’re not even married! Off Gwen’s look.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: ... We wanted a bastard.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Well, I proposed to Gwen as soon as I found the pregnancy test in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Wow. Romantic.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: How’d you meet her?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: The girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: At a comic book convention.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: She a nerd?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No... she was working.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What does she do? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: She has her own business.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Doing what?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Designing pet clothing.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You can make a living designing pet clothing in New York?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Her parents are rich.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: How rich?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: They bought her a brownstone for her birthday.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, now, I understand why you don’t want to get married.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Well, what’s the point? She’s already taking care of you. You’re getting everything you want out of it.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Jason.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Well, not exactly. We keep our money separate.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: But you don’t have any money. 65. 43 a *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: You’re drunk.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: So, go do the dishes. Jason looks at Gwen... Then gets up.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: But, you don’t have any money, right?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Jason. Jason clears the dishes and exits. Gwen gives John a sympathetic look.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You still smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Gwen share a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: How's your mom?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: She's okay. She has a brain tumor.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I heard. I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Don’t be. She’s doing better than everyone else in my family. My dad and brother are totally falling apart.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: How about you? How are you doing? John thinks about this.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Okay. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: You must be scared.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I guess, a little.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Your mom is such a sweetie. She use to give me updates about you the first few months after you left.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) Look, Gwen. I’m sorry I never called.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: We were engaged. *

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I know. I know. I’m such an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: It's okay. I knew we weren’t really going to get married.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Even when you proposed, I knew you weren’t going to follow through on it. *

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess, you always knew me too well.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: (laughs ) I’m not sure I ever really knew you at all.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No, tell me.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t know what you’re like now but all through school you were so desperate to be liked, to be accepted. + eH (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah, me and every other teenager in the world.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: No, it was different with you. You were terrified of disappointing anyone... like your mom... You were always what people wanted you to be, and never what you needed to be. Beat. This hits John.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, yeah, I knew you weren’t going to call when you left. I hoped you would but...I think it was important for you that you didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: See. You do know me. Gwen looks at John and realizes...

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: You haven’t changed at all, have you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HH FF HHH HH

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yes. No. Sort of. I don’t know. Not really... I think I’m just going through a tough time.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: ... When are you not? Gwen smiles. John looks at her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (laughs ) You still drawing cartoons? *

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Kind of. *

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You still writing? *

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: No... Do you want to have sex with me? * Gwen tosses the cigarette. She straddles John. *

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I shouldn’t.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m going to have a kid.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. It doesn’t really change that much. John stops Gwen.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I hope that’s not true. Pause. Gwen hardens.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: What does she do that’s so special? John thinks about it... Hadn’t realized til he says it...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: She lets me be who I need to be. * Gwen looks a little stung by this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. What are you doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I was trying to seduce John but he thinks he’s in love with his girlfriend. Jason laughs. Then he abruptly stops laughing.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: That’s not true, is it?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No. I mean... the part about me being in love with my girlfriend is. But the rest was a joke. John forces a laugh. Gwen frowns. Jason looks really confused.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: We're out of beer.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (eager to get out of there) Oh, I’1l go get more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John screeches his mom’s car out of the driveway. He calls Rebecca on his cellphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is on his cellphone. We hear ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca sits knitting what looks like a child’s sweater but it has four leg holes. Her phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: John? Oh my God, I haven’t heard from you in like two days. I was worried.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Rebecca, I just saw Gwen. Silence.  48 71.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I went over to her house for dinner-- with her and her husband. (beat) Honey, she kissed me.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (taken aback) You kissed her... ok.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No, no, she kissed ME! Major difference.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I-- I thought you said you didn’t have feelings for her anymore. I mean she just had a kid. John turns into the Liquor Barn. He finds a parking spot.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I don’t-- She did-- oh btw, she still looks great by the way! So you have nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Still looks great?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean she may have gained a little weight, but I never really liked skinny girls.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Rebecca, please, forget about the way she looks. It’s not important. The point is, kissing her, it didn’t do anything for me. I mean, if anything it just PROVED my feelings for you.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Oh, John. You sound like a basket case.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No, I don’t. I know what I’m saying. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You are not making me feel very secure right now.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I know. But I will. I promise I will. Starting right now.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You’re drunk. John gets out of the car. He puts a cigarette in his mouth and looks for a lighter.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: A little but that’s not why I’m saying this. Listen--

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You're probably still smoking, too, aren’t you? John throws the cigarette to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No. I just quit. John goes into the Liquor Barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks around the liquor store for a six pack of beer while talking on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m trying to tell you that I love you. I love you. Okay. I just...I don’t know. I wanted you to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (moved) ++. John. Suddenly, John spots his father, wearing an apron, stocking wine coolers on shelves. He slowly drops the phone away from his ear. REBECCA (CONT’D) +.. John?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Dad? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Johnny. What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Dad, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (faint telephone voice) John? John? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (to Rebecca) Sorry, Rebecca. I’m going to have to call you back.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: John. What’s going on?? John-- John hangs up. Don looks at the same young Mexican American man we saw before... who is now behind the cash register.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Pedro, I’m going to take five.

dialogues.speaker: PEDRO
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) My name is not Pedro.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Thanks. Don smiles and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don and John sit on the tailgate of Don’s truck in the parking lot, having a beer.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. How did it get this bad?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: We're in a lot of debt... I took out three small business loans. Mortgaged the house. I thought that would see us through the recession but now the money’s gone and we’re still not making a profit. I got nothing left to pay my employees with. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: So, are you bankrupt?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: I haven't filed.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Dad, I can give you some money.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Don’t be ridiculous. You don’t have any money.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Rebecca does.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: I’m not going to take her money.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: But I want to help. Don shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: You got your own family to worry about. I‘ll figure this out.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: How? Don looks out at the highway.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I didn’t spend more time with you growing up. John looks to Don. Don continues looking out.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, Dad. I don’t care about that-

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: --I do. I never got to know you, I mean really know you. As a man. And it’s... one of the greatest regrets of my life.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: ++. You're just going through a tough time.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: When am I not? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: This registers with John.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God, I wasted so much on that stupid business. And now I’m probably going to lose it all and it’s... terrifying.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: It’s not over yet. You’re not going to lose it all.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: No, it’s terrifying to realize this late...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: What really matters.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: -.. We still have time.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: I did it all for you kids and your mom, you know.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: ... And we’re all proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A New York Yellow Cab stops in front of the Hollar house in the middle of the night. Rebecca gets out of the cab with an overnight bag. The cab drives off. Rebecca waddles up to the front door of the Hollar house. She rings the doorbell. She looks kind of angry. Ron comes to the door in boxers and a woman’s robe.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (Sleepy) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Where’s John? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: In bed.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Where’s that?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Upstairs. Rebecca walks past Ron and up the steps towards John’s room.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I’m Rebecca. She disappears up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (In a bit of awe) +.. You’re Rebecca. 52 INT. JOHN’S ROOM, HOLLAR HOUSE. NIGHT. 52 John has fallen asleep with the light on in his room. He is surrounded by black and white cut-outs of the super hero from his graphic novel in various poses. He has drawn them all himself. Rebecca enters the room. She looks at all the cartoons. Ron follows behind Rebecca in one of his mother’s robes.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (softly) John? Rebecca puts her hand on John’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: John? John wakes. He looks at Rebecca. He is very confused.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Is this a dream?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: No. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (looking at his brother) Why is he wearing my mother’s robe?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’m Ron, it’s so good to finally meet you. Ron retreats.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Ron, please.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Don’t ever hang up on me again.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. (beat) How did you--

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I took a cab.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (looking at the drawings) What is all this?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Drawings. I thought we could put them in the baby’s room. I read somewhere that baby’s like contrast.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: They're beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I've missed you.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I’ve missed you, too.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: My ass is really sore.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you took a cab here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John and Rebecca embrace. We see that Ron is still in the doorway. He watches covetously for a long moment, then leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron's car pulls up in front of his ex-wife’s house and parks. It is dark and there are no lights on inside. Ron runs around the side of the house and hops over a fence to get to his daughters’ room. He taps on the window. Constance comes to the window, putting on her glasses. Ron gestures for her to open it.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: (sleepily) Dad?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hi, Angel.

dialogues.speaker: MATILDA
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I miss you guys. Beat. RON (CONT’D) Do... Do you miss me? After a beat... they both nod.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ron is elated.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Can I come in? The girls laugh.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’m comin in! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: But mom says--

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about Mom. Move Ellie. Matilda moves an elephant stuffed animal that sits on the table. Ron jumps up and awkwardly tries to come through the window. The girls end up pulling him in, laughing. Ron smiles and sshs them playfully. He then hugs both of them tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don sleeps with his head on Sally’s stomach as Sally stares out the hospital window, her hand on his head. INT. MATILDA AND CONSTANCE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 54 Ron and the girls have pushed the girls single beds together. They all sleep peacefully.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. HOLLAR HOUSE. NEXT DAY. 55
dialogues.text: Rebecca and John sleep in a lovely embrace. Morning light streams over their bodies. Then suddenly Rebecca wakes up with a sharp pain in her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Oww! John wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What? What is it? A kick?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: It felt more like a stab. Ow!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Is this normal?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t have driven here.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Ow! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rebecca grabs John’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: John!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stares at newborns through a window, contemplating his imminent future. A nurse comes out to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: OB NURSE
dialogues.text: John?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: How is she?

dialogues.speaker: OB NURSE
dialogues.text: She’s fine. She’s just needs to rest. You can take her home tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Is the baby okay?

dialogues.speaker: OB NURSE
dialogues.text: Their vitals are good.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What do you mean their?

dialogues.speaker: OB NURSE
dialogues.text: You're having twins. You didn’t know?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We wanted to be surprised. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: OB NURSE
dialogues.text: Surprise. John looks like he has been punched in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca lies in a hospital bed. She looks very nervous. John walks into the room.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You have to get me out of here.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: They said you should rest. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beat. John looks 81. 57

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I’m not giving birth in this hospital.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with this hospital?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Nothing. It’s just not in New York.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I was born here, you know.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I know... I just want my doctor. *

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: My mom’s having surgery here.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: But I don’t know this place. And the people are too nice.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with being nice?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: It makes me nervous.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: -+. Did you know we were having twins?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (sheepishly) .--. Yeah. They told me at the last * appointment. *

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I was afraid it would be too much. * very upset. REBECCA (CONT’D) It was the same day we found out about your Mom. Then you left. And, with all that you’re going through, I can’t even tell if you want to have a baby at all so to tell you we were having TWO I was--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: All I’ve been going through?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: John, you're not happy. It’s obvious. With work, with your life, maybe even with me. And I know that you’re just going through something, and that you’re scared and that your life maybe isn’t everything you want it to be right now and I get it... having a baby is scary. And you're worried we’re not going to be fun anymore. And that you’re going to have to stay at this job that you hate. And that you're never going to have beer with your friends. And you’re never gonna kiss your high school girlfriend. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That’s not what I’m worried about. *

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: It’s not? *

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No, having twins.... it’s one more person * that I’m gonna be failing. And I just * can’t take that. John tries hard not to break. Rebecca sits up and grabs his hands and touches his face.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: John. John! Listen to me! John scoffs at this. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: John, you're the most amazing, talented, good hearted person I’ve ever met. And you are not failing anyone! REBECCA (CONT’D) We're just here waiting for you to come back.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You promise?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I promise. (beat) Now, * (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I will. Now get some rest. John smiles. EXT/INT. STACEY’S HOUSE. DAY. 58 Stacey sleepily exits her room and knocks on the door immediately next to hers, then opens it.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: Constance, Matilda. Wake up, it’s time for school. Stacey begins to walk away, routinely... then freezes. She turns back to the doorway, seeing Ron.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Ron wakes, seeing Stacey.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Oh, Stacey--

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hear me out.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: How did you get in?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I just wanted to see them.. Stacey pauses... which way will she go? INT. STACEY’S HOUSE. DAY. 59 Two cops walk Ron out of the house in cuffs as his wife and children watch.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: You're not allowed in this house again. Under any circumstance. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (yelling to Stacey) Come on, Stacey. Don’t you think you’re over-reacting? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STACEY
dialogues.text: Ron, you broke into my house!! This is why I have full custody. A60 EXT. STACEY’S HOUSE. DAY. A60 The cops lead Ron out of the house. They pause at the bottom of the stairs as Ron looks out to see... the entire neighborhood is watching. The cops push Ron forward. Ron steps over the flowers considerately.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Watch the flowers. The cops trample the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Dan pleads with one of the cops who allows him to go over to the cruiser. When Ron sees Reverend Dan he looks angry.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Not the time, man. Not the time, I promise you.

dialogues.speaker: REV. DAN
dialogues.text: How you doin’, Ron? Ron stares pained daggers.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: --. You’re somethin’ else, man. You’re somthin’ else. Things aren’t bad enough you have to come over here and what? You win man... you win.

dialogues.speaker: REV. DAN
dialogues.text: Your girls sent me. Ron’s face falls. He looks lost.

dialogues.speaker: REV. DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What were you doing in the house, Ron?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I’ve just been feeling so lonely. I didn’t know where else to go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ron looks emotional.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why does she hate me?

dialogues.speaker: REV. DAN
dialogues.text: She doesn’t hate you. REV. DAN (CONT’D) Would you like to talk about it? Reverend Dan puts his hand on Ron’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No!... Kind of.

dialogues.speaker: REV. DAN
dialogues.text: Come on. Let me buy you a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Okay. Rev. Dan motions to the cop who walks over.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait, you’re not going to try and push any of that Jesus shit on me, are you?

dialogues.speaker: REV. DAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You promise? The cop lets Ron out.

dialogues.speaker: REV. DAN
dialogues.text: I don’t force my beliefs onto people.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: REV. DAN
dialogues.text: Really. The cop uncuffs Ron.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Well, what are your beliefs?

dialogues.speaker: REV. DAN
dialogues.text: You just asked me not to talk about them. Rev. Dan and Ron walk down the street together. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, now I’m curious.

dialogues.speaker: REV. DAN
dialogues.text: It's complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally stands looking out the window. She is alone in her room. LaTisha is gone. John walks in wearily.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Mom? What are you doing up? Where is everyone?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Gone.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What happened to LaTisha?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: She’s in surgery. Sally smiles... very unconvincing. John walks right up to her. Both fragile.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Dr. Fong just came by. John braces for the worst.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: He said I have to shave my head.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (relieved) Oh, Mom. That’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I don’t want to do it Johnny. Sally’s stoicism is finally beginning to wane. SALLY (CONT’D) I’m going to look ridiculous. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No... you won’t. When are they coming to do it?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Well, I’1l wait right here til they do. Sally looks at her son for the first time. She sees everything.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: How are you? John just nods, trying not to break. SALLY (CONT’D) How’s Rebecca?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: ++. we’re having twins. Sally gives John a huge hug. He almost collapses into her.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: -.. and you're terrified. John breaks. He just nods as his eyes well up. Sally looks right into him. Warm. Always motherly.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t worry... you won’t know til you get there... that you’re ok. John looks at her and for the first time... is comforted. And for the first time in what feels like forever... He smiles. Jason comes into the room with an electric razor.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Alright, Mrs. Hollar. You ready for your new do? John looks at Jason.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey. It’s you. (beat) What happened? You never came back to the house. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (lying) I got lost.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Gwen's pissed.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Will you tell her I’m sorry?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Yeah. Whatever. I got to give your mom a haircut. John looks to Sally.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just sit right here Mrs. Hollar, we'll be done in no time. Jason wraps her in a hair cutting cloak. And faces her towards a mirror. Seeing herself in the mirror, Sally's face changes. Jason, turns on the clippers.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You ready? Sally looks almost terrified.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No. Wait. Jason looks at John.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ll do it.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Leave the clippers and the razor... I’1l give her the haircut. John looks to Sally.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If it’s okay with you?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: You really want to?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’d be honored. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jason leaves. John gives his mother a haircut. It is a very sweet and intimate moment between mother and son. John finishes the haircut.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Oh, you’re just saying that.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No, I’m not. You got a really nicely shaped head.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Well, thank you. John takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Wait for supper? (beat) It’s my last meal.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Last meal.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: They’re not letting me have any food tomorrow. I guess you’re not supposed to eat before the surgery.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: So, what’s on the menu for tonight?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Yogurt and a boiled egg.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s not a very good last meal.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What would you want? If you could have anything? Anything in the world? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Oh, I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You don’t know? Are you telling me you can’t even fantasize about a good meal? Sally thinks.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: A burger.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That’s it? Just a burger?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: No, I mean a real burger. John thinks about this.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: What, now?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: We can’t. They’1ll never let me leave.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We’ll sneak you out.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: You'll get in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m not going to let you have an egg and yogurt for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John wheels his mother down a hospital hallway. Jason spots John and Sally leaving from the nurse’s station.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Hey. Where are you going? John starts to run. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: A64
dialogues.text: gl.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop, stop! You can’t leave! John and Sally duck into a room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally and John laugh then turn around to see... A woman is giving birth. She screams in pain and terror. Her husband tries to comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH 1
dialogues.text: Her husband tries to take her hand. She bats it away. Sally peaks out the door while John stares at the woman in total shock and horror. Suddenly a nurse looks up and sees John and Sally.

dialogues.speaker: LABOR NURSE
dialogues.text: What’s going on here?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: (looking back at the hallway) Alright he’s gone. Let’s go. John wheels his mother out of the room. SALLY (CONT’D) (to the woman) You're doing a great job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pushes Sally out of the hospital. They are both giddy with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Sally peel around the corner of a parking lot and drive through the emergency room arrival area. Just as they pass the doors... Jason exits and runs after the car screaming. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Wait! Stop! You’re not supposed to leave the hospital. (mutters to himself) Assholes. INT. JANIE’S. LATE DAY. 64 John and Sally walk into Janie’s, a small eatery frozen in time. John smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I thought this place closed forever ago.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Never. Sally waves to the women behind the counter. They wave back. SALLY (CONT’D) Hi girls! INT. JANIE’S. LATER. A65 John and Sally are finishing burgers.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: My, God, I haven’t had one of these in...

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Long time. John smiles. SALLY (CONT’D) You sure this is okay? I look like an escaped mental patient.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I don’t even think anyone has noticed. Sally shrugs. She eats another fry.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, mom.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What did you mean when you said you regretted marrying dad?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: +. Did I say that?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: (dead straight) It must have been the tumor.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: «+. Mom.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: John, I love your father. He’s my life.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: But you said you regretted--

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: You never met my mother. She was tough. Quiet. And tough. The day I married your father, she only gave me one piece of advice. “Don’t waste your time with the bad. Live with the good.”... Your father and I have lived thirty two good years. John looks right at her... and nods. Ron and Don enter.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Oh, good, I thought we’d miss you...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What happened to your hair?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We had to shave it.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: What do you think, Donald?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: I think you look great, Chief. Don gives Sally a kiss on her bald head... Sally looks to John. EXT. JANIE’S. DUSK. Sally exits Janie’s... with her family. B65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, Don, Ron and Rebecca are all in Sally’s hospital room. Sally wears a head scarf. No one says anything. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: What time is it? Everyone in the room checks their watch. 93A. 65 (CONTINUED)
Sally nods.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Thanks for being here, everyone.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: We love you, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I love you, guys. Don starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, Don. Don’t worry. It’s going to be okay. I’m going to be fine.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about Jenny Craig. Sally opens her arms for Don to give her a hug. They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Take care of Ron for me. He needs your help. Don nods.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Of course, Chief. Sally beckons Ron over to her. Ron bends down for a hug.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Take care of your Dad for me. He needs your help.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (nods ) I got it. John comes over to give his mom a hug.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: See you soon, Mom. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: (More poignant) Take care of them for me. They need your help.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Sure thing, Mom. A moment of silence. John puts his arm around Rebecca. Jason comes into the room.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You ready, Mrs. Hollar? Sally does not say anything.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hollar? Sally tries hard not to cry but she can’t hold it in. She is so scared.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: (bursting into tears) I don’t want to do this. No one knows what to do or say.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (to Ron) What should we do? Ron shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (whispers ) You could sing to her.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Does that help?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (to Ron) Do you know the words to any songs she likes? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: She likes Kenny G. John gives Ron a look.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m not even sure if I know the words to any songs, period.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: We could hum something. While Ron and John bicker about what to do Don quietly and sweetly breaks into a tune.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: I'm trying to tell you something about my life...maybe give me insight between black and white...the best thing you’ve ever done for me...is to help me take my life less seriously, it’s only life after all...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Is that the Indigo Girls? Ron nods.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How does he know the words to this?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: She loves this song ever since she watched their Behind the Music story. Ron joins in.

dialogues.speaker: DON AND RON
dialogues.text: Well darkness has a hunger that’s insatiable...and lightness has a call that’s hard to hear...I wrap my fear around me like a blanket...I sailed my ship of safety till I sank it, I’m crawling on your shore... John tries to join in with the chorus. He doesn’t know all the words but he does his best. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DON, RON AND JOHN
dialogues.text: I went to the doctor, I went to the mountains..I looked at the children, I drank from the fountain...there’s more than one answer to these questions...pointing me in a crooked line...the less I seek my source for some definitive...the closer I am to fine... The song continues as actually sung by the Indigo Girls as Jason wheels Sally out of the room. Sally smiles and mouths a “thank you” to Don. Don grabs her hand for a moment, then lets her go. Rebecca gives John a kiss on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally is rolled into an elevator. Song continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally is rolled down hallway to surgery. Song continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song continues as Sally takes her anesthesia and goes to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song continues as John, Don, Ron and Rebecca sit patiently in the waiting area. John looks out over his family. Ron gets up.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’m gonna go... get some air. Ron exits. John gets an idea he exits. Suddenly Don looks at Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Better. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Thank you for being here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rebecca looks up at him. He smiles. It’s the first moment Rebecca’s had with Don.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron stands outside. John comes out and joins him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beat. 98. 68

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: How you doin’ Ron?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I'm fine. I’m good.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We are terrible liars.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How's the job search going?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Okay. I’m waiting for a second interview at Amazon.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Oh. Wow. That’s a good company.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No, not that Amazon. The club in Bristol. They need bartenders.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Do you bartend?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No. John smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just need a job.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You know dad wants you back?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What? No he doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That’s not what he told me.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Dad wants me to work for him again?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Not for. With. He wants you to run the company with him.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You're right you are a terrible liar. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No. I’m not. He’s just too proud to ask. But he can’t really pay you until the company gets back on its feet.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: He can’t pay me?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Well, you’re staying at his house rent free.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah. That’s his duty as one of the people who brought me into this world without asking.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Come on, Ron. He needs your help. Ron looks kind of intrigued. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’1l think about it.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hey, what did mom say to you?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just that she loved me. Why, what did she say to you?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: The same. Ron and John smile.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See you inside. John walks back in. We hold on Ron’s smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John re-enters the waiting area. And goes to his father.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Yeah? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Ron wants his job back.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: He needs to work. He’s willing to come back without pay until the company gets up on it’s feet again.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: He said he’d work for no pay?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That’s exactly what he said.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: But you'll have to make him vice president.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: I'll make him queen of England if he can start makin money again.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Great. He’ll start next week. John looks up at Rebecca, who saw the whole thing. She smiles knowingly at John. He smiles at her genuinely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John paces around while Rebecca sleeps and Ron and Don talk. Dr. Fong comes out into the waiting room. Everyone looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FONG
dialogues.text: Well, the operation was a success. Everyone cheers.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We were able to remove 95 percent of the tumor.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: 95%? Why couldn’t you remove it all? (CONTINUED)
70 Ron looks to John.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FONG
dialogues.text: The tumor is putting a good deal of pressure on the brain stem. You don’t want to mess with the brain stem.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: So, it could grow back?

dialogues.speaker: DR. FONG
dialogues.text: It could. We’ll have to watch it.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: When can we see her doctor?

dialogues.speaker: DR. FONG
dialogues.text: We're moving her to intensive care. You can visit her once she’s settled. But she’s still heavily sedated.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Thank you, so much, Dr. Fong. I can’t tell you how much we appreciate everything you’ve done for her.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FONG
dialogues.text: Let’s just keep an eye on her. See how she progresses. We’re not out of the woods yet. She’s been living with that tumor for a long time. We have to see how the brain responds to it’s removal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don, John and Ron stand in front of Sally. Her head is heavily bandaged. Her heart is hooked up to a monitor.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: I‘ll stay with her. Why don’t you boys go home and get some rest?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: We want to stay.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: No, no, take Rebecca home. You two should sleep in a real bed.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Are you sure? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Yeah. Go. You, too, Ron. Ron doesn’t move. Don speaks right to him for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s gonna be okay. Ron and John leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, Ron and Rebecca walk into a hospital elevator together.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: She is going to be okay, right?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Better then ever.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Tell Dad I’1l take the job. EXT. STACEY’S HOUSE. DAY. A73 Ron knocks on the door. Stacey answers with Reverend Dan. The girls run out with back packs on hugging Ron then running to the car.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: «.. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don sits next to Sally and holds her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron plays Dance, Dance, Revolution with his daughters. They are all surprisingly good. John and Rebecca watch on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Are you sure you’re okay?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Yeah, fine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rebecca is not convinced.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We’ll get you back home soon. Ron stops dancing. He looks at John.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You want to try? John and Rebecca get up and play the dancing game. Everyone is laughing and happy. It’s a very warm moment between the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don sleeps holding hands with Sally. Sally opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Don? Don wakes. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Hey, Chief. How you doing? Sally smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Did they get it?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Yeah. They got it. The tumor’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Oh, good.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: You did great, Chief. Sally blinks. And then without warning her heart rate drops. Don turns to the machine in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sally? Sally? Honey? Sally? A nurse runs into the room.

dialogues.speaker: ICU NURSE
dialogues.text: What happened? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: I don’t know. More nurses come into the room.

dialogues.speaker: ICU NURSE
dialogues.text: We need a doctor in here right away! A nurse starts pumping Sally’s heart.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: What’s going on? What are you doing to her?

dialogues.speaker: ICU NURSE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir. You're going to have to leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: But Dr. Fong said the surgery was a success.

dialogues.speaker: ICU NURSE
dialogues.text: Please, sir.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. Don steps backwards towards a chair. Time slows down. Sound fades out to the sound of the heart monitor. Slowly the beep turns into a faint flat line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron sleeps in a make shift fort with his daughters. The phone rings. Ron gets up and answers it.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hello. Ron looks very upset. INT. JOHN’S ROOM. DAY. 77 Ron walks into John’s bedroom. He and Rebecca are sleeping in each other’s arms. Ron gently wakes his brother.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: John. John. John wakes up in a panic, as if in a bad dream. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What? What is it? 78 INT. DR. FONG’S OFFICE. DAY. 78 Don, Ron and John sit in Dr. Fong’s office.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FONG
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. There was just nothing we could do. She had lived with that tumor a long time. Her body just couldn’t adjust to the change.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I thought the procedure was a success? Ron looks to John.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FONG
dialogues.text: It was.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (truthful anger) Do all your successes end in death???

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (calming... like his mom) Ron.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FONG
dialogues.text: (flustered) Look, I understand this is a hard time for you. I did everything I could.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (quietly) Thank you, doctor. Don turns to leave. He bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don, John and Ron sit in the front pew of a church going over the details of Sally’s funeral with a funeral director and a minister. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MINISTER
dialogues.text: She will be presented here in front. Do you know what flowers you’d like to have surrounding the casket?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: --. I don’t know. No one speaks. Ron just stares at the empty space where the casket will be.

dialogues.speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Now, as far as caskets go--

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: --We’'ll take the best one you got.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: That’s... a lot of money, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: I don’t care.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Well, how are we going to pay for it?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: We just pay for it.

dialogues.speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Actually, all expenses have already been taken care of.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What? By who?

dialogues.speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: An anonymous party. Don looks really confused.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: We don’t know any anonymous parties. John realizes who it was.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I think I have an idea.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Are you ready, Dad? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: I think I’m going to just... be here for a bit. John and Ron stand and put their hand on their father’s back. They slowly exit the viewing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron and John exit into the foyer of the church.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You think dad’s going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: --. I don’t know. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m gonna take a walk... I’1l see you at home?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ron walks away. Off to the right, John sees Rebecca looking at a statue. John approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you just pay for my mother’s funeral?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Don’t tell your father. I wanted to do something. You told me he was strapped for cash.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That’s really generous but we can’t accept it.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I just can’t.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: John, please accept it. I have money now. You’ll have money later. It doesn’t make any difference. We're family. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John is really touched. He doesn’t know what to gives Rebecca a long, hard look.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Will you marry me?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Marry me. 108. Rebecca doesn’t know what to say. John pulls a pen out of his pocket and draws a line around Rebecca’s ring finger. She looks at the ring, fighting tears.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: It’s beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Marry me. Right now.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Well, do you think now is a good time?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: It's for better or worse, right? I can’t think of a worse time then now. What you say?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Yes! A82 EXT. CHURCH. DAY. John and Rebecca run to the car. 82 EXT. CHURCH - PARKING LOT. DAY. 81 say. He do

dialogues.speaker: A82
dialogues.text: 82 John and Rebecca get into his mothers car. They look at each other with nervous excitement. John starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Take me to some place she loved. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John smiles and reverses out of the parking spot. Just as he stops to put car in drive, in his rearview mirror we see Ron walking slowly to his car.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (to Rebecca) Hold on. John exits the car and walks towards Ron. Through the back window we see John talk to Ron. After a moment. The two brothers walk back to the car and get in. John smiles at Rebecca. Rebecca smiles at Ron. Ron smiles... touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Rebecca stand in front of the little swimming hole John visited earlier in the story... Along with Reverend Dan and Ron. They get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Rebecca slow dance without music watching the sun go down. Behind them Ron stands talking to Reverend Dan.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: This is nice.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah. My mom used to take my brother and me here to swim every summer. Rebecca nods.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We got to bring our kids here when they get older.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Every summer. John looks at Rebecca and smiles. He starts to weep.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, honey. Rebecca holds John.  85 86 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don sits at the kitchen table alone. He looks out at the empty kitchen. In front of him is a bowl of Sally's knitting. After a long beat, Ron enters in the doorway behind him.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad. The girls and I were going to go get some ice cream. You want to come? Don looks at Ron.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: No, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Want us to bring anything back for you? Don doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll get you a Dilly bar. Ron stands and looks at his dad for a beat... then exits. Don continues to sit at the table staring out the window. The doorbell rings. Don sighs. The doorbell rings again. Don goes to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don answers the door. Jason stands at the doorstep.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Hollar. Don nods.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m very sorry about--

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: What do you want? Jason takes a breath. He pulls a envelope out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Sally asked me to give this to you if...you know. Jason hands the envelope to Don. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She was a great woman.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Thanks. Don closes the door. He takes the envelope back to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don sits back down at the kitchen table and opens the envelope. There is a simple note card in it. The note card reads, “If you're reading this letter then I guess I didn’t make it.): I’m sorry I can’t be there to help you through this, Donald. But you’re going to be okay. Buck up. You gave me a great life. I love you so much. Sally.” Don starts to weep. The doorbell rings again. Don gets up and goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don answers the doors with tears in his eyes. It’s Jason, again. He holds another envelope.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: She asked me to wait five minutes and then give you this one. Jason hands the envelope to Don. Don opens it right there at the door. This note card reads, “Stop crying. You got a funeral to plan. Don’t forget I like orchids.” Don smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thanks for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally's coffin is surrounded by orchids. A large group of Sally's friends and family are gathered around her casket as it is about to be lowered into the ground. Don, John, Rebecca and Ron sit in chairs in the front. Don bravely tries to hold in his tears but he can’t help welling up. Behind him we see that everyone has shown up for Sally. Stacey stands with Reverend Dan, Constance and Matilda. Pam is there. Everyone is emotional.

dialogues.speaker: MINISTER
dialogues.text: In the end the message is most clear in the first book of Corinthians... “Behold, I show you a mystery: We shall not all sleep; but we shall all be changed” The minister says his last few words... then there is silence. John looks around.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Someone should say something.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Someone from the family should say something before they put her into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Go ahead. John takes a breath... then stands up.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hello. I’m John Hollar. I’m Sally’s son. (Saying this immediately has an impact) I unfortunately don’t quite know what to say. I just want to thank everyone for coming here... to say goodbye to our mother. He looks out at the group. This is his family. This is his life.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I, uh... I remember talking to my Mom -. in a time where I was a bit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks directly at Rebecca. She tears up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lost... And my Mom said... “You won't know till you get there... that you’re ok.” Beat. He looks out at everyone, finishing with his Dad.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, we’re all here. And she was right... We’re ok. John finishes and goes to hug his father. As he does Rebecca touches her stomach. She starts to feel some serious pains. Ron looks at Rebecca. Rebecca is going into labor. She grabs Ron's hand aggressively.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Uh, John. John looks over.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: John! You're wife is going into labor. John runs over to Rebecca and helps her to her feet and begins to walk Rebecca to the car and exits. After a moment he returns.... and kisses the casket.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Bye, Mom! We love you. INT/EXT. RON’S CAR, CEMETERY. DAY. 91 Ron, John, Don, Rebecca are all packed in Ron’s car.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Everyone got on their seat belts?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just go. Go, go! Ron peels out. The car goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Shit. I never did get that fixed.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Everyone begins to panic. Ron looks around. He gets an idea.  92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron closes the door to... the hearse. Rebecca is next to him. John and Don are in the back.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I feel like this is a bad way to bring kids into the world.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No, no. It’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Here we go! As the hearse screeches out of frame, in the background we see... Sally’s casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse drives down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. HOSPITAL. DAY. 93
dialogues.text: Ron pulls the hearse up to the emergency drop off. He jumps out of the hearse and looks around as John helps Rebecca out of the car. Ron suddenly sees an old man in a wheel chair.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Dad... have a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Have a heart attack now! Don suddenly sees the man in the wheel chair... And begins faking a heart attack. Ron smiles... then drops it as he rushes up to the man.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please! I need this wheel chair my father’s having a heart attack!! The old man stands up, confused. Ron takes the wheelchair to the hearse... And Rebecca gets in. The old man watches as Ron and Rebecca rush into the hospital followed by John... and then Don. The old man stares at Don. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron runs up to the nurses desk.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: We're having a baby! Where do we need to go?

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE
dialogues.text: Down the hall and to the left. Everyone starts to head down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait! Everyone stops.

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can’t all go. John looks at his dad and brother.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’1l call you when we get a room.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Good luck, Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Thanks, Dad. John gives his dad a hug. Then his brother. Don leans down and kisses Rebecca on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Thank you for being here. John pushes Rebecca down the hall. Ron looks at Don.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You think they’re gonna to be alright?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Yeah. They’1l be fine.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: -.. What about us? Don gives his son a big hug.  116. INT. HOSPITAL HALLWAY. DAY. Rebecca is screaming as John pushes her down a white, gleaming hallway.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You promised me we wouldn’t have the babies here.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I didn’t know you were going to be early.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I’m scared.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You’re not supposed to tell me that.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: It’s going to be okay. You’re going to do great.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Just breathe.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I am breathing.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Becca?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I love you, too. EXT. HOSPITAL. SKY BRIDGE. DAY. John pushes Rebecca in a wheel chair over a glass sky bridge to the hospital.  117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a nurse appears looking at a clipboard, then down at Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE 2
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hollar?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: +e. yes.

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE 2
dialogues.text: Right this way. The nurse hits a button as two large hospital doors open. John, Rebecca and the nurse run through and out of sight. As the doors close behind them... we fade to white.
